Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of flu deaths in the previous year by stating that 80,000 Americans died, while the actual number reported by the CDC was 61,000 deaths for the 2017-18 influenza season.
Understate: The claim understates the number of flu deaths in the most recent year by not acknowledging the CDC's report of 34,000 deaths during the 2018-19 influenza season.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only relies on a news article from two years ago that has since been revised by the CDC.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption by equating the number of flu deaths to the severity of COVID-19, suggesting that the flu is equally or more dangerous.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may exist to provide an alternative explanation or downplay the threat of COVID-19 by comparing it to the flu and questioning the necessity of preventive measures.
